text: Roberto Oscar Ferreiro (25 April 1935 â€“ 20 April 2017) was an Argentine professional football player and manager. Ferreiro played club football for Independiente and River Plate. He earned 18 caps in the Argentina national team between 1962 and 1966. After retiring as a player Ferreiro went on to become a manager, taking charge at Independiente in the 1970s. He led the team to a number of championships, including the 1973 Intercontinental Cup and Copa Libertadores 1974. Ferreiro died on 20 April 2017 in Buenos Aires at the age of 81. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Argentine footballers Category:Argentine football managers
